bug.short_desc: Refactor demos as application part of Demobrowser

long_desc.thetext:
An issue with current demobrowser is the fact that demos are stand-alone apps that are loaded in an iframe. This makes browsing through and switching between demos slow.
The demos should therefore become part of the demobrowser application.

- Stand-alone: A constraint of the new solution is that demos must remain runnable by themselves. This is a requirement for the framework developement, which uses demos to develop new features.
If demos become parts of a larger application, it should be possible to have a generic application frame (index.html + helper classes) that is able to plug-in any of those demos and run them as stand-alone apps, outside the demobrowser.
- Theming: Another open issue is theming. Currently, all demos come in two themes. This is achieved by generating two versions of the same demo. If demos become a part of the demobrowser application, how can we theme this particular part, without changing the theme of the whole demobrowser?

The general question remains how to better integrate the demos with the demobrowser, but the requirements and the perspective on what is considered "better" has possibly changed. The newer bug (#2482) tries to reflect that, so I'm closing this one.
